pageContext.claim: “I feel very badly for Paul Manafort and his wonderful family. “Justice” took a 12 year old tax case, among other things, applied tremendous pressure on him and, unlike Michael Cohen, he refused to “break” - make up stories in order to get a “deal.” Such respect for a brave man!”
pageContext.analysis: There's no reason to suggest that Michael Cohen's plea deal is based on false testimony. Generally, if a witness lies to prosecutors after making a deal, prosecutors can dissolve that deal. in other words, it would be against Cohen's interests to say anything false.
